column5: Hi all,  I am looking for the hottest disposable/re-useable heat pads on the market so that my dad can once again enjoy steelheading/ice fishing as much as he used to.  Thanks!
My buddy has Reynauds which means his toes are freezing all the time. He gets the heat packs from Costco for a good price. Thin enough to go in his boots he swears by them.
Have a look at these electric socks.  http://www.cabelas.ca/product/72845/world-famous-battery-operated-heated-socks  Dan.
Those socks look great. Wonder if they would go in ski boots?

I bought a pair for my daughter, when she was at law school in Ottawa; she loved them. It was approx a 20 block walk to the university and she said her feet stayed nice and toasty. They did eat batteries though; she'd wait until her feet started to feel cool and then turn them on.  Dan.
Lots of how-to's online for making your own heated clothing...
